p: Food systems and the way they function determine not only the quantity and quality of the food supply and people’s diets, but also the quality, sustainability and resilience of the livelihoods of a large share of the world’s population. By livelihood we mean the capabilities, assets and activities required for a means of life that allows people to achieve a minimum level of wellbeing (Chambers & Conway, 1991). Climate change threatens these livelihoods and imposes the need for systematic and transformative adaptation which in turn calls for expanded and innovative financing.
